intro: Ficus cassidyana var. casiguranensis, commonly known as the Casiguran ficus, is a rare and unique species native to the Philippines. It is a member of the Moraceae family, characterized by its distinctive morphology and ecological adaptations. The plant typically features a dense, broad canopy with large, heart-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts.
